page.title: 05Farming in the area
page.content: Farming nowadays is not very profitable.Most farmers rely on tourism. The farmer in New Hedges lets two of his fields to tourists. His other fields are used to grow crops, and to make silage. Some farmers have changed their dairy cattle to beef cattle. Now the E.E.C. say that the farmers have to get rid of some of their own cattle because there has been a 10% reduction in the milk quotas.That means that the animals either have to be sold or be killed. There are coniferous forests around the coast between Saundersfoot and Tenby which can be used for building. Near the woods are beautiful fields and hedges which encourage wildlife.
